org.tal.redstonechips.wireless
Class BroadcastChannel

java.lang.Object
  org.tal.redstonechips.wireless.BroadcastChannel

public class BroadcastChannel
extends Object

Represents a wireless broadcast channel that receivers and transmitters can communicate over.

Author:
Tal Eisenberg

Field Summary

          Contains the last broadcasted message.

public BroadcastChannel(String channelName)

Method Detail

addReceiver

public void addReceiver(Receiver r)
Adds a receiver to receive broadcasts on this channel.

Parameters:
r - The receiving circuit.

removeReceiver

public boolean removeReceiver(Receiver r)
Stops the receiving circuit from receiving broadcasts on this channel.

Parameters:
r - The receiving circuit.
Returns:
true if the receiver was actually removed.

addTransmitter

public void addTransmitter(Transmitter t)
Adds a transmitter to transmit broadcasts on this channel.

Parameters:
r - The transmitting circuit.

removeTransmitter

public boolean removeTransmitter(Transmitter t)
Stops the transmitter from transmitting broadcasts on this channel.

Parameters:
r - The transmitting circuit.
Returns:
true if the transmitter was actually removed.

getTransmitters

public List<Transmitter> getTransmitters()
Returns:
All transmitters that are broadcasting on this channel.

getReceivers

public List<Receiver> getReceivers()
Returns:
All receivers that are receiving broadcasts on this channel.

getLength

public int getLength()
Returns:
The number of bits used by the channel. This value automatically changes according to attached receivers and transmitters.

transmit

public void transmit(BitSet7 tbits,
                     int startBit,
                     int length)
Transmits a message over this channel to all its receivers.

Parameters:
tbits - The bits to transmit
startBit - The channel bit the message will start at.
length - The length of the message.

transmit

public void transmit(boolean bit,
                     int position)
Transmits 1 bit over this channel to all receivers. The transmission can set any bit of the channel bit set. To set the 1st bit position should be 0.

Parameters:
bit - The bit to transmit.
position - Position of the bit in the channel's bitset.

isDeserted

public boolean isDeserted()
Returns:
true if the channel has no registered circuits.

updateReceiver

public void updateReceiver(Receiver r)
Sends the receiving circuit all current channel bit values.

Parameters:
r - A receiving circuit.

isProtected

public boolean isProtected()

checkChanPermissions

public boolean checkChanPermissions(org.bukkit.command.CommandSender sender,
                                    boolean admin)
Parameters:
sender -
admin - whether sender should be an admin/owner of this channel.
Returns:
true if the sender have permissions.
